text.author: Supreme Court of the United States
text.summary: In a case before the United States Supreme Court on behalf of Michael Jones, attorney Silas J. Wasserstrom argues that an individual found not guilty of a crime by reason of insanity cannot legally be held under involuntary commitment for longer than they would have been incarcerated for a guilty verdict.
text.title: Michael Jones v. United States
